results.title: For Emma Stone, Being Bad Feels Awfully Good
results.abstract: With “Cruella” and other recent projects, the Oscar winner is drawn to playing an antiheroine: “There’s something so freeing about it,” she says.

results.title: For ‘F9,’ Making Stunts That Stick
results.abstract: The concept of electromagnets factor heavily into the new film, creating the impression of cars stuck together and leaving stacks of wreckage in a way only the “Fast and the Furious” films know how.

results.title: Colman Domingo’s Crooked Summer
results.abstract: He’s proud to have appeared in, and championed, films that show off Black men at their soulful best. His roles in “Candyman” and “Zola” are different.

multimedia.caption: “People who don’t know me from stage work don’t know I always played dark characters and villains,” the actor Colman Domingo says.

results.title: John Krasinski and the Tense Wait for ‘A Quiet Place Part II’
results.abstract: It’s been more than a year since the film he wrote and directed was originally set for release. Now, as the sequel to the 2018 hit reaches theaters, Hollywood is holding its breath.

multimedia.caption: Emily Blunt, Millicent Simmonds and John Krasinski, who said that as he waited for the film to come out, he spent the past year hovering “somewhere between optimism and naïveté.”

results.title: Natalie Morales Makes Her Directing Debut. Twice.
results.abstract: With “Plan B” and “Language Lessons,” the actress is finally getting to start a career behind the camera, a goal one talent agency couldn’t understand.

results.title: Film or Real Life?
results.abstract: Sometimes a place is more than just a place; it can be a scene. Even the blankest backdrops, like a parking lot or a sun-baked freeway, can shimmer with cinematic potential. Four photographers showed us the movie moments that they found all over.
results.byline: By Jolie Ruben, Amanda Webster and Raillan Brooks

results.title: ‘Her Man’: A Relic of a Bygone Hollywood, Now Restored
results.abstract: Now streaming, this mildly racy romance, from 1930, arrived before the censorious Production Code. What really sets the film apart is its incredible tracking shots.

results.title: Mike Faist Isn’t Sure About This Whole Acting Thing
results.abstract: “I can’t tell if I hate acting or if I love it too much,” he said ahead of the debut of the Amazon series “Panic.” Coming soon, a major role in Steven Spielberg’s “West Side Story.” For now, he’s going to Ohio.

results.title: Kevin Spacey Cast in Italian Film After Being Sidelined in the U.S.
results.abstract: He will play a detective in the movie, directed by Franco Nero, in what is believed to be his first film since sexual assault allegations started surfacing in 2017.

results.title: Happy Birthday, Bob Dylan, Our Most Underappreciated Comic
results.abstract: As he turns 80, don’t be fooled by his serious music. From the start, his work has been filled with a cockeyed humor that can range from corny jokes to dark wit.
